properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 3:49PM EST until February 13 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
...SLIPPERY TRAVEL EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
MORNING...

.Low pressure tracking across southern New England will spread
snow across New Hampshire and Maine beginning around or just after
midnight tonight. It will start first across western New
Hampshire around midnight, then spreading across the rest of New
Hampshire and Maine by 4 AM. Snowy conditions will affect the
morning commute on Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow expected, possibly heavy at times late tonight.
Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches expected. Some
freezing drizzle possible during the morning and early afternoon
hours at higher elevations.

* WHERE...Western and Central Hillsborough and Cheshire Counties.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 PM EST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions during the Thursday
morning commute with low visibilities.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to
www.weather.gov/gray..

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 PM EST THURSDAY
